decks.notes: This deck focuses on using artifacts and the Urza, Lord High Artificer to control the board and generate advantage. The key strategy involves using cards like Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek to create a Thopter army, while also utilizing cards like Mystic Forge and Whir of Invention to dig for key pieces. The deck also has disruption elements like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb to handle opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to slow down the game and grind out value through artifact synergies and control elements.

This Aggro deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast, efficient creatures and direct damage spells. With Monastery Swiftspear, Goblin Guide, and Eidolon of the Great Revel providing early pressure, combined with burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Boros Charm, and Searing Blaze to finish off the opponent. Sunbaked Canyon and Fiery Islet provide card draw while fixing mana, ensuring a consistent stream of threats and removal. The deck aims to close out the game quickly and efficiently, not giving the opponent a chance to stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly lower its own life total to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler while using disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the game. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by flashing back key spells, and Temur Battle Rage can quickly end the game by giving a massive creature double strike and trample. Mishra's Bauble and Thought Scour help to fill up the graveyard for delve creatures and enable card advantage. Overall, this deck combines aggression with disruption to put pressure on opponents and secure victories.

The deck is focused on assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Scapeshift to deal massive amounts of damage in a single turn by getting multiple Valakut triggers. The deck utilizes ramp spells like Explore, Sakura-Tribe Elder, and Search for Tomorrow to quickly get to the necessary lands to enable the combo. Primeval Titan and Summoner's Pact allow for additional land tutoring and acceleration. The inclusion of cards like Prismatic Omen and Field of the Dead provide additional support and value to the combo strategy.

This Modern aggro deck focuses on fast and efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, along with creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide to quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells. The mana base is built around dual lands that provide both red and white mana, allowing for easy casting of Boros Charm and Lightning Helix. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless barrage of damage.

This aggressive red deck aims to quickly deal damage to the opponent through efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Spike, as well as creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The deck also includes cards like Boros Charm and Searing Blaze to control the board and protect its creatures. The mana base includes lands that can deal damage to the player in order to maximize the damage output of the deck. The key strategy is to apply constant pressure and quickly finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Mine, and Power Plant) in order to quickly ramp up mana and cast powerful threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Karn Liberated. The deck aims to control the game with removal spells like Oblivion Stone and win through big threats like Wurmcoil Engine and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck also has access to powerful sideboard options with Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's strategies and access to artifacts like Walking Ballista for additional removal.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also using aggressive creatures like Dreadhorde Arcanist and Seasoned Pyromancer to apply pressure. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board. Blood Moon is included to disrupt opponent's mana base, while cards like Chandra, Acolyte of Flame and Liliana of the Veil provide additional value. The deck aims to be proactive and aggressive, taking advantage of the disruption and pressure to win quickly.

This deck aims to control the game by countering opponent's spells, removing threats, and outvaluing them with powerful planeswalkers and equipment. It focuses on maintaining board presence with value creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic, while using counterspells and removal to answer threats. The combination of disruptive cards like Cryptic Command and Teferi, Time Raveler, alongside powerful finishers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Batterskull, allows the deck to dictate the pace of the game and grind out victories through attrition and card advantage.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Jace. The deck utilizes efficient creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Force of Negation and Cryptic Command allows the deck to adapt to various threats and outmaneuver opponents. By efficiently managing resources and maintaining board control, this deck aims to grind out opponents and secure victory through incremental advantage and powerful late-game threats.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by using low-cost, efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly before they have a chance to stabilize. By combining direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt with fast creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Goblin Guide, the deck can quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The deck also includes cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel to punish opponents for casting spells, further increasing the pressure on them.

This deck focuses on assembling a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and put into play using various tutors. It aims to create a strong board presence and combo off using cards like Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies to generate infinite mana and Walking Ballista to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes protection and utility cards like Giver of Runes and Sword of Fire and Ice to help stabilize and control the game. The creatures toolbox aspect of the deck allows for flexibility and adaptability in different matchups.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan while generating value through artifacts. It utilizes cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Thopter Foundry/Sword of the Meek combo to create a strong board presence. The deck also includes various artifacts to search for key pieces and answer threats, such as Mystic Forge, Goblin Engineer, and Galvanic Blast. Additionally, it runs a mana base that allows for flexibility in casting spells and activating abilities. Ultimately, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a slower-paced game.

The main focus of this UR Storm deck is to cast a large number of spells in a single turn to generate a lethal storm count and finish off the opponent with a massive Grapeshot. The deck utilizes cards like Baral, Chief of Compliance and Goblin Electromancer to reduce the cost of spells, while also including cantrips like Serum Visions and Opt to draw through the deck quickly and find key combo pieces. Gifts Ungiven is a powerful tool for finding the necessary cards to set up the combo, making the deck a formidable force in the Modern format.

This Jund Aggro deck focuses on efficient creatures and disruption spells to put pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. Utilizing powerful cards like Bloodbraid Elf, Tarmogoyf, Liliana of the Veil, and Wrenn and Six, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Kolaghan's Command. With a mix of aggressive creatures, removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push, and versatile planeswalkers, this deck aims to win the game through a combination of damage and disruption.

The key concept of this deck is to disrupt opponents' game plan by forcing sacrifices and discards with cards like Smallpox, Liliana of the Veil, Inquisition of Kozilek, and Thoughtseize. Lingering Souls and Bloodghast provide recurring threats while Stoneforge Mystic fetches equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Fire and Ice for additional pressure. Gideon, Ally of Zendikar offers a versatile win condition. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue opponents while maintaining card advantage and resilience through recurring threats and life gain.
